description: A special shell from Skypiea that can record and playback sound. Brook has been carrying one inside his skull for 50 years containing the Rumbar Pirates' final performance of Bink's Sake.
abilities: Can store recordings for extended periods (50+ years)

keyMoments.title: Brook Reveals the Tone Dial
keyMoments.description: Brook opens his skull and reveals he's been carrying a Tone Dial containing his crew's final message for Laboon.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals how Brook has preserved his crew's legacy and his unwavering commitment to his promise.

keyMoments.title: Decision to Use the Tone Dial
keyMoments.description: The dying Rumbar Pirates decide to record Bink's Sake on the Tone Dial as their final message for Laboon.
keyMoments.significance: The Tone Dial becomes the vessel for the crew's legacy, transforming their tragic death into a message of hope.

keyMoments.title: Recording Bink's Sake
keyMoments.description: The Tone Dial records the Rumbar Pirates' final performance as they die one by one.
keyMoments.significance: The recording captured on this Tone Dial becomes one of the most important artifacts in One Piece, preserving the crew's final moments.

keyMoments.title: Playing the Recording at Thriller Bark
keyMoments.description: Brook plays the Tone Dial recording at Thriller Bark while everyone sings along, connecting past and present.
keyMoments.significance: The Tone Dial fulfills its purpose of keeping the crew's memory alive and sharing their joy with new friends.
